title: Misty conditions expected during the morning
byline: The Meteorology Department says mainly fair weather will prevail over most parts of the island.

title: 7.6 magnitude earthquake shakes Caribbean, some islands urge residents to leave coastlines
byline: A magnitude-7.6 earthquake shook the Caribbean Sea southwest of the Cayman Islands Saturday, according to the U.S. Geological Survey, and some islands and countries urged people near the coastline to move inland in case of a tsunami.

title: Sri Lanka targets 2.5 million new coconut plants in 2025
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board has announced plans to reorganize the Kapruka Fund Management Board Societies as part of efforts to expand coconut cultivation across the country.

title: Island-wide beach cleanup campaigns to commence today
byline: The inauguration of the program, “A Beautiful Beach, An Attractive Tourist Destination,” is scheduled to begin today (February 9) under the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative.

title: Three arrested in connection with Rajagiriya murder
byline: Police have arrested three suspects in connection with a murder that took place in the Rajagiriya area recently.

title: Accident involving bus in southern Mexico killed 41, authorities say
byline: A traffic accident involving a bus in southern Mexico, which took place in the early hours of Saturday morning, killed 41 people, the government of Tabasco state said in a statement, adding that recovery work was still ongoing.

title: Cabinet sub-committee to probe impact of Uma Oya project
byline: A Cabinet sub-committee is set to be appointed to look into those affected by the ‘Uma Oya’ project, Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure, Samantha Vidyaratne said.

title: Mt. Lavinia Police Constable reported missing with T-56 firearm
byline: A Constable attached to the Mount Lavinia Police Station is reported missing, along with his T-56 firearm, the Police Media Spokesman said.

title: Sudden power cut reported island wide
byline: UPDATE (12.11 p.m.): The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that the System Control Centre of the CEB is currently in the process of resolving the island-wide power outage and restoring the supply.

title: Cause of island-wide power outage revealed
byline: An ‘emergency situation’ at the Panadura grid substation has caused the island-wide power outage, the Ministry of Power and Energy revealed.

title: Public urged to use water sparingly due to power outage
byline: The ongoing island-wide power outage is also likely to cause disruptions to the water supply.

title: Power restored in several areas
byline: The power supply to several locations including the National Hospital in Colombo, the Ambathale Water Purification Plant, and areas of Biyagama and Sapugaskanda has been restored, according to the Energy Minister.

title: Public advised to be cautious at railway crossings due to power outage
byline: The General Manager of Sri Lanka Railways warns that the gates and warning systems at railway crossings may malfunction due to the prevailing power disruption.

title: Power restored to over 50% of the country: Ministry
byline: The power supply has now been restored to over 50% of the country, according to the Ministry of Energy.

title: 14 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A special operation conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy has resulted in the seizure of two Indian fishing boats and the apprehension of 14 Indian fishermen for poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Fire breaks out in shop and two houses in Angoda
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out in a shop and two houses in the Angoda area, the police said.

title: Four hospitalized in after inhaling smoke from generator
byline: Four people have been hospitalized in the Bogawantalawa area due to inhalation of emitted from an electricity generator.

title: Power restored to all areas - Energy Ministry
byline: The power supply has now been fully restored to all areas in the country, according to the Ministry of Energy.

title: Investigation into island-wide power failure: CEB
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that an investigation is to be carried out into the island-wide power failure today to identify the cause or causes for the hours-long outage.

title: Power disruptions reported again due to Norochcholai plant issue - CEB
byline: The General Manager of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said that power disruptions have been reported again in several areas due to the Norochcholai coal power plant not functioning.

title: Short-sighted actions by previous govts led to nationwide power outage - Energy Minister
byline: Energy Minister Eng. Kumara Jayakody states that no prior plans were implemented in the past to maintain the stability of the national power grid.
